name: Legal Updates Knowledge Base
description: Recent legal and regulatory updates in Indonesia - company law, labor law, environmental regulations, licensing

legalUpdates.source: Ministry of Law and Human Rights
legalUpdates.title: PT PMA Minimum Capital Reduced
legalUpdates.summary: Minimum capital requirement for PT PMA reduced from IDR 10 billion to IDR 5 billion for technology and creative industry sectors.
legalUpdates.details: The government reduced barriers to foreign investment in priority sectors. Eligible sectors: technology, creative industries, education technology, healthcare technology. Other sectors remain at IDR 10B minimum. Existing PT PMAs not affected. New applications only.

legalUpdates.title: Bali Minimum Wage Increase 2025
legalUpdates.summary: Minimum wage (UMK) in Bali increased to IDR 3.2 million per month, up 8% from 2024 (IDR 2.96M).
legalUpdates.details: All companies in Bali must adjust employee salaries by February 1, 2025. Applies to all workers with less than 1 year experience. Penalties for non-compliance: fines up to IDR 400 million or imprisonment. Provincial review conducted annually based on inflation and economic growth.

legalUpdates.title: OSS Face Recognition Verification Mandatory
legalUpdates.summary: OSS system now requires face recognition verification for company directors in all new NIB applications.
legalUpdates.details: Biometric verification aims to reduce fraud and nominee director issues. All new business license applications (NIB) require directors to complete face recognition verification via OSS mobile app. Existing businesses not affected unless renewing licenses.
legalUpdates.implementation: OSS mobile app updated with face recognition feature

legalUpdates.title: Stricter AMDAL Requirements for Bali
legalUpdates.summary: Environmental Impact Assessment (AMDAL) now required for all developments above 5000 sqm in Bali (previously 10000 sqm).
legalUpdates.details: Bali-specific regulation to protect environment and cultural heritage. Threshold lowered: developments >5000 sqm now require full AMDAL study. Coastal zones have even stricter rules (>2000 sqm). Processing time 6-12 months. Cost IDR 100-500 million depending on project size.
legalUpdates.coastal_protection: Enhanced restrictions in 50m from high tide line

legalUpdates.title: Second Home Visa Extended to 10 Years
legalUpdates.summary: Second Home Visa for wealthy foreigners extended from 5 to 10 years validity. Investment requirement increased to USD 250,000.
legalUpdates.details: Program targets high-net-worth individuals. Requirements: minimum USD 250k investment in Indonesian property or business, health insurance, proof of funds USD 130k. Benefits: 10-year stay permit, multiple entry, can own property via Hak Pakai, family members included.

legalUpdates.title: Bali Tourism Levy Implementation
legalUpdates.summary: IDR 150,000 tourism levy per foreign visitor implemented for Bali entry.
legalUpdates.details: Revenue allocated to cultural preservation and environmental protection. Collected upon arrival at Ngurah Rai Airport or seaports. Indonesian citizens and residents exempt. KITAS/KITAP holders exempt. Payment via online platform or airport counter.

legalUpdates.title: BPJS Contribution Rates Updated
legalUpdates.summary: BPJS employment insurance contribution rates adjusted for 2025.
legalUpdates.details: New rates effective January 2025: Old Age Savings (JHT) 5.7% (employer 3.7%, employee 2%), Pension 3% (employer 2%, employee 1%), Work Accident 0.24-1.74% (employer only), Death 0.3% (employer only), Healthcare 5% (employer 4%, employee 1%). All employers must register employees within 30 days of hire.
legalUpdates.penalties: Administrative sanctions and fines for non-compliance
